Detailed Description

A button that will display a popup menu when pressed.

Parameters:
The menu id for the desired action index
Returns:

void DzMenuButton::clear (  )  [slot]

Clears the menu associated with this object and sets the text of the button back to the default

The number of items in the menu

The text currently displayed on the button

The default text displayed to the user
QMenu * DzMenuButton::getMenu (  )  const [slot]

This method should be used if the convenience methods provided by this class are not sufficient. Warning: DO NOT DELETE THIS POINTER!

Returns:
The menu displayed by this button
int DzMenuButton::getSelectionID (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The id of the currently selected menu item, DZ_MENU_BUTTON_NO_SELECTION if no current item is selected or the button is in an indeterminate state
int DzMenuButton::getSelectionIndex (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The index of the currently selected menu item, or DZ_MENU_BUTTON_NO_SELECTION if no current item is selected or the button is in an indeterminate state
int DzMenuButton::insertItem ( const QString &  text,
int  id = -1,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Convenience function. Inserts an item into the menu associated with this object.

Parameters:
text The text to be displayed in the menu
id The id for this menu item
index The index (starting at 0) location where the item is to be inserted
Returns:
The allocated menu identifier (id if id >= 0)
int DzMenuButton::insertSeparator ( int  index = -1  )  [slot]

Convenience function. Inserts a separator into the menu associated with this object.

Parameters:
index The index (starting at 0) location where the separator is to be inserted
DzMenuButton::menuIndexSelected ( int  which  )  [signal]

Emitted when an item in the menu is selected

Parameters:
which The index of the item selected.
void DzMenuButton::mousePressEvent ( QMouseEvent *  e  )  [protected, virtual]

Processes mouse clicks and displays the menu for this button

Parameters:
e The mouse press event
void DzMenuButton::removeItem ( int  id  )  [slot]

Removes the item with identifier id from the menu associated with this object. WARNING: To avoid issues with button text incorrectly updating, use this method rather than QMenu's removeItem() method.

Parameters:
id The id for the menu item
void DzMenuButton::removeItemAt ( int  index  )  [slot]

Removes the item at location index from the menu associated with this object. WARNING: To avoid issues with button text incorrectly updating, use this method rather than QMenu's removeItemAt() method.

Parameters:
index The index location (starting at 0) for the menu item to remove
void DzMenuButton::selectItem ( int  menuID  )  [slot]

Selects the item with the menu id menuID

Parameters:
menuID The id of the menu item to be selected
void DzMenuButton::selectItemAt ( int  index  )  [slot]

Selects the item at location index

Parameters:
index The index location of the menu item to be selected
void DzMenuButton::setButtonText ( const QString &  text  )  [slot]

Sets the button text displayed to the user to text. Note, this method invalidates any previous selection made, and calls to getSelectionID() and getSelectionIndex() will return -1 until a valid item has been selected.

Parameters:
text The text to set on the button
void DzMenuButton::setButtonText ( int  menuID  )  [protected]

Sets the text of the button to the text corresponding with the menu item at menuID.

Parameters:
menuID An id from the menu associated with this object. If not a valid id, the text of the button does not change
void DzMenuButton::setIndeterminate (  )  [slot]

Puts this object into an indeterminate state, displaying the indeterminate text, until a new selection is made, either programmatically or by the user

void DzMenuButton::setIndeterminateText ( const QString &  text,
bool  setIndeterminateNow = false 
) [slot]

Sets the default text to be displayed on the button. i.e. after a clear()

Parameters:
text The new default text to be used
setIndeterminate If true, the button will be placed in an indeterminate state
void DzMenuButton::setItemEnabled ( int  menuID,
bool  enable 
) [slot]

Enables/Disables the item with menu id menuID

Parameters:
menuID The id of the menu item to be enabled/disabled
enable Whether the item should be enabled/disabled
void DzMenuButton::setItemEnabledAt ( int  index,
bool  enable 
) [slot]

Enables/Disables the item with menu id menuID

Parameters:
index The index location of the menu item to be enabled/disabled
enable Whether the item should be enabled/disabled
